intro: Cremanthodium hookeri subsp. polycephalum, commonly known as the many-headed cremanthodium, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous root system. The plant produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom during the summer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
